titleStmt.title: Edward H. Green to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG14233

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 1

body.p:
Jeffersonville, Indiana
January 27" 1865
Govenor Thos E. Bramlette.
Sir.

I received to day the recommendation herewith transmitted. This recommendation was kindly furnished me without soliciation on my part, which, coming from the distinguished source it does, is rendered doubly valuable to me. The position refered to in the Petition has been filled by your Excellency, and the sellection of Major Frederick Slater, was an excellent one. He is not only a perfect Gentleman but a gallant and honerable Officer.

I however forward the recommendation to your Excellency, and if a position of a higher rank than the one I now occupy should become vacant, and you deem me worthy, I wshould be pleased to have the Petition recognized by my appointment thereto.

I am Govenor
Very Respectfully
Your Obt Sv't
Edward H. Green

Says the position refered to in the encolsed peitition has been filled, but asks that you will consider the petition, if a position of a higher rank than the one he now occupies, should become vacant --
Recd A. G. O. Ky 30 Jany 1865
